content.description: Scramble up brushy slab to steep scoop with mostly good hand holds and fickle feet.  Top out is not steep or difficult but keeps your attention.  5-6 bolts, trending right.
content.location: Farthest left route at the Blank Cave.  Right-trending bolt line through scoop.

content.description: This is the left extension of Finally Legal, skip the chains of that route and clip a few more bolts of hard looking climbing.
content.location: starts on finally legal, busts left at those chains without clipping them.

content.description: Start just left of the 5.10 slab and head up a rounded arete with tricky pocket pulling.  The crux is figuring out how to get to the solution pocket on the left.  Poor feet and tiny pocket pulling is the business.
This is the right extension to Finally Legal, dont clip those chains instead move right inside the big pod FL finishes in and clip a long draw above your head. A few more bolts of climbing follow.
content.location: Starts on Finally Legal and heads right at the big pod.

content.description: Start in alcove around corner from D'Zard. Stem through the pocketed face to the shared anchor/rappel station.
content.location: Find the obvious alcove around the corner from D'Zard on the hike up to the Blank Cave.

content.description: AKA Chert line, this is a classic route on the left side of the blank cave. It tackles an amazing ladder of chert blobs up a swath of lovely blue/ grey stone. Hard crimpy climbing with an engaging finish.
content.location: left side of the blank cave, look for the chert!

content.description: This is makes for a high quality pitch when linked with Oh Yeah or D'Zard.  The rock is a little sharp but it is solid with interesting holds.  Belay on a nice ledge and bring your partner up.  Rap twice...
content.location: Extension pitch to the lower 5.10s on the slab

content.description:
This is the next step up in difficulty, since the rest of the routes in the cave are 5.12 and up.  Clip one bolt on the adjacent 5.13 and make a hard left onto the slab. Don't head straight up.  It looks easy enough, but it turns into 5.13 tugging.

The crux comes at a bulge with some interesting crack and pocket features.  Long slings are a must to avoid rope drag on the traverse.
content.location: Start in the cave and traverse out the left side...

content.description: Many thanks to Bill Ohran for bolting this sweet line!! Starts out with maybe 35 feet of easy slab then goes to 12- vertical and you will get to the technical crux after about 20 feet of that. then about 10 feet above that you will get to the RP crux which is clearing a roof and getting into the corner above it. chains are a bit above the roof.
content.location: on the right side of the blank cave. the line goes up a slab and then into a corner closer to the top.

content.description: Starts with a little bit of technical crimps side pulls and underclings up to a jug with a possible kneebar rest. Which is not really needed unless you messed up and took forever on the bottom. Up a few more jugs to a side pull and the crux (really long move up to some more jugs. Eases up and goes to a big hueco rest and then to the chains and a jug thats hard to see which is good to clip from. Really fun climb!!
content.protection: Maybe 8 draws. I cant remember if there is permadraws or not.
content.location: Second...maybe third route from the left.

content.description: Start up sharp but interesting rock through a low crux bulge. Follow interesting rock to a shared anchor.  This is a good morning warm-up in colder temps.
content.location: This is the 3rd route from the left on lower slabs
